snippet: At the Supreme Court, the attorney general’s office consistently backs officers accused of abuse, even as it pursues civil rights investigations against several local police departments.
abstract: Justice Dept under Atty Gen Eric H Holder has sided with police officers in every Supreme Court case involving accusations of excessive force, drawing criticisms from some who say police abuses could best be stemmed at federal rather than local level; every federal decision in favor of officers makes it more difficult for citizens to seek justice for claims of mistreatment.

byline.original: By MATT APUZZO and ADAM LIPTAK

lead_paragraph: At the Supreme Court, the attorney general’s office consistently backs officers accused of abuse, even as it pursues civil rights investigations against several local police departments.

headline.main: At Supreme Court, Eric Holder’s Justice Dept. Routinely Backs Officers’ Use of Force
headline.print_headline: Holder’s Team, in Balancing Act, Often Aligns With the Police
